channel.title: Xbox 360 vs ps3
channel.description:
I KNOW THERE IS 1 ALRDY MADED BUT I QUOTED THE MESSAGE I GOTTEN WHEN I WAS TRYIN TO REPLY TO IT!
Warning: this topic has not been posted in for at least 120 days. Unless you're sure you want to reply, please consider starting a new topic.
________________________________________________________________________________
Ok thx for readin :)
I chose for xbox 360 because i got one.. ppl say Xbox sucks Because from the online u need to pay But look at the game prices of ps3 its soo dam high Thats why u aint pay online:)
if i had the money i would buy a PS3 to ;) i love them both :) beside that Xbox 360 Got WAY More games then a PS3 Doesnt mean the xbox 360 is beter :)

item.title: Xbox 360 vs ps3
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:36, topic:376437”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=472368.msg3454857#msg3454857 date=1293980050]
The PS3 also has more RAM, a better hard drive, better networking, and better audio .
[/quote]
[size=5pt]Both the PS3 and Xbox 360 have a total of 512MB of memory.

The PS3’s memory is split into VRAM and System RAM.

PS3 System RAM: 256MB XDR memory @ 3.2Ghz
PS3 VRAM: 256MB GDDR3 memory @ 700Mhz

The Xbox 360’s memory is the full 512MB shared between both the GPU and CPU.

512MB GDDR3 memory @ 700Mhz.

As for networking. Yeah, the PS3 has the Gigabit Ethernet port, but the Xbox 360’s 100Mbit is more than it will ever be required to do. So, that part is irrelevant.

Wireless, the 99% of the PS3s have 802.11b/g built in. The Xbox 360 has only just started building wireless in, but has had the option for 802.11n for a while, and the new models have 802.11n built in.

So, not really better networking. Not in any practical sense, anyway.

I also own both the consoles (two of each, an old model of each, a new slim model of each) but I do prefer the PlayStation 3 for its exclusives. Sony own around 20 of their own studios, whereas Microsoft own around 5. Sony can make more exclusives for its system, whereas Microsoft cannot - and have to rely on third part developers, who often don’t always stay exclusive or never make them properly exclusive in the first place, and release them on PC too - where they are better.

The Xbox 360 has xbox live, which is brilliant, I don’t think it is worth the money, but it is better than PlayStation network for features and uniformity. But, actual online play - I see little to no difference between the two. Except Sony seemed to be a little more willing to be a bit more open - with stuff like MAG (256 player online games), and LittleBigPlanet - user generated content shared across networks - which Microsoft said themselves they would be hesitant to do for security reasons.[/size][/quote]
Thats because more people hack on xbox rather than Playstation network. Plus, as soon as someone gets a little bit of freedom to make something custom on XBL, they take advantage of it and make penises and vaginas everywhere (referencing to Black Ops emblem customization.)

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 vs ps3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Liquid Magic:

The PS3 also has more RAM, a better hard drive, better networking, and better audio .

Both the PS3 and Xbox 360 have a total of 512MB of memory.

The PS3’s memory is split into VRAM and System RAM.

PS3 System RAM: 256MB XDR memory @ 3.2Ghz
PS3 VRAM: 256MB GDDR3 memory @ 700Mhz

The Xbox 360’s memory is the full 512MB shared between both the GPU and CPU.

512MB GDDR3 memory @ 700Mhz.

As for networking. Yeah, the PS3 has the Gigabit Ethernet port, but the Xbox 360’s 100Mbit is more than it will ever be required to do. So, that part is irrelevant.

Wireless, the 99% of the PS3s have 802.11b/g built in. The Xbox 360 has only just started building wireless in, but has had the option for 802.11n for a while, and the new models have 802.11n built in.

So, not really better networking. Not in any practical sense, anyway.

I also own both the consoles (two of each, an old model of each, a new slim model of each) but I do prefer the PlayStation 3 for its exclusives. Sony own around 20 of their own studios, whereas Microsoft own around 5. Sony can make more exclusives for its system, whereas Microsoft cannot - and have to rely on third part developers, who often don’t always stay exclusive or never make them properly exclusive in the first place, and release them on PC too - where they are better.

The Xbox 360 has xbox live, which is brilliant, I don’t think it is worth the money, but it is better than PlayStation network for features and uniformity. But, actual online play - I see little to no difference between the two. Except Sony seemed to be a little more willing to be a bit more open - with stuff like MAG (256 player online games), and LittleBigPlanet - user generated content shared across networks - which Microsoft said themselves they would be hesitant to do for security reasons.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 vs ps3
item.dc:creator: @_SITTION |SITTION|
item.description:
@_SITTION wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:28, topic:376437”]As I own both consoles, I think I could make a fairer comparison, then you er, fanboys.

To start with, PS3 exclusive games have amazing graphics. GT5 and Unchartered 2 were both examples of this.
However, multi-platform games like Black Ops or Medal of Honor had considerably worse graphics on the PS3 than the Xbox. I also found that games loaded slightly faster on the Xbox 360 aswell.

PSN is free, which is nice, but I found Xbox Live to have more features, like integration with MSN and video chat.

Xbox 360 controllers are nicer than PS3 ones, I found the PS3 ones a little uncomfortable, whereas the Xbox controller is moulded to fit the hand.

I think that the PS3 Xmb is better than the Xbox 360 dashboard, I found it more responsive and cleaner looking. Also, the PS3’s ability to play Blu-ray movies was one of its selling points for me.

In conclusion: It’s really down to personal preference. My favourite of the two is the Xbox, but I still love the PS3 and think that they are both great consoles.[/quote]

That’s True the Xbox controller Are so nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 vs ps3
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

As I own both consoles, I think I could make a fairer comparison, then you er, fanboys.

To start with, PS3 exclusive games have amazing graphics. GT5 and Unchartered 2 were both examples of this.
However, multi-platform games like Black Ops or Medal of Honor had considerably worse graphics on the PS3 than the Xbox. I also found that games loaded slightly faster on the Xbox 360 aswell.

PSN is free, which is nice, but I found Xbox Live to have more features, like integration with MSN and video chat.

Xbox 360 controllers are nicer than PS3 ones, I found the PS3 ones a little uncomfortable, whereas the Xbox controller is moulded to fit the hand.

I think that the PS3 Xmb is better than the Xbox 360 dashboard, I found it more responsive and cleaner looking. Also, the PS3’s ability to play Blu-ray movies was one of its selling points for me.

In conclusion: It’s really down to personal preference. My favourite of the two is the Xbox, but I still love the PS3 and think that they are both great consoles.

Read full topic

The PS3 also has more RAM, a better hard drive, better networking, and better audio .[/quote]Well yeah, there’s that too

I just like XBox 360 better overall though. Besides, more of my friends have it, only 4 or 5 of my friends have PS3 where as the rest have 360.
